titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Helen Brett receipts 1977.610
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-01-12T14:14-0500

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Helen Brett receipts, 1977.610, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Kenneth A. Lane, date unknown.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Mrs. Helen Brett resided at 355 Cumberland St. in Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Helen Brett receipts collection consists of two receipts for the purchase and subsequent sale of a piano, dated 1877 and 1882. The first is from Phelps & Son Pianos, located at 323 Washington St. in Brooklyn. The other is written out to Charles Lane, to whom Mrs. Brett later sold the piano.
